  • Method
org.vertx.java.core.eventbus

Interface Message<T>


  • public interface Message<T>
    Represents a message on the event bus.

    Instances of this class are not thread-safe

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T body()
      The body of the message
      void reply()
      Same as reply(T message) but with an empty body

      Reply to this message.

    • Method Detail

      • body

        T body()
        The body of the message

      • replyAddress

        java.lang.String replyAddress()
        The reply address (if any)

      • reply

        void reply()
        Same as reply(T message) but with an empty body

      • reply

        void reply(java.lang.Object message)
        Reply to this message. If the message was sent specifying a reply handler, that handler will be called when it has received a reply. If the message wasn't sent specifying a receipt handler this method does nothing.

      • reply

        void reply(JsonObject message)
        Reply to this message. If the message was sent specifying a reply handler, that handler will be called when it has received a reply. If the message wasn't sent specifying a receipt handler this method does nothing.

      • reply

        void reply(JsonArray message)
        Reply to this message. If the message was sent specifying a reply handler, that handler will be called when it has received a reply. If the message wasn't sent specifying a receipt handler this method does nothing.

      • reply

        void reply(java.lang.String message)
        Reply to this message. If the message was sent specifying a reply handler, that handler will be called when it has received a reply. If the message wasn't sent specifying a receipt handler this method does nothing.

      • reply

      • reply

        <T> void reply(Handler<Message<T>> replyHandler)
        The same as reply() but you can specify handler for the reply - i.e. to receive the reply to the reply.

      • reply

        <T> void reply(java.lang.Object message,
             Handler<Message<T>> replyHandler)
        The same as reply(JsonObject message) but you can specify handler for the reply - i.e. to receive the reply to the reply.
